trans-unit.source: Indicates a serialization surrogate selector class.

Surrogate selectors implement the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector> interface to assist formatters in selecting surrogates to delegate to the serialization or deserialization of other objects.

Specifies the next <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> for surrogates to examine if the current instance does not have a surrogate for the specified type and assembly in the specified context.

This method is protected by a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction?displayProperty=fullName> for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag?displayProperty=fullName> specified.
The next surrogate selector to examine.
The caller does not have the required permission.
Returns the next surrogate selector in the chain.

This method is protected by a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction?displayProperty=fullName> for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag?displayProperty=fullName> specified.
The next surrogate selector in the chain or `null`.
The caller does not have the required permission.
Finds the surrogate that represents the specified object's type, starting with the specified surrogate selector for the specified serialization context.

This method is protected by a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction?displayProperty=fullName> for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag?displayProperty=fullName> specified.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of object (class) that needs a surrogate.
The source or destination context for the current serialization.
When this method returns, contains a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> that holds a reference to the surrogate selector where the appropriate surrogate was found.
The appropriate surrogate for the given type in the given context.
The caller does not have the required permission.
